intro: Triteleia lugens, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Triteleia in the family Liliaceae, which includes other bulbous plants. The plant produces showy, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its bulbs are adapted for storage and can survive periods of drought. Triteleia lugens is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
